triageFlags.title: Excessive Term Length
triageFlags.description: The proposed term length exceeds the maximum allowable term for any agreement.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application or adjust the term length to comply with policy.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the underwriting policy, the maximum term for any agreement is 60 months. The proposed term of 72 months violates this policy, indicating a significant risk.

triageFlags.title: Debt-to-Income Ratio Exceeds Threshold
triageFlags.description: The applicant's DTI ratio exceeds the maximum allowable threshold for their credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application or reassess affordability to reduce the DTI ratio.
triageFlags.reasoning: The applicant's credit score places them in Tier C, which has a maximum allowable DTI ratio of 35%. The current DTI ratio of 31.43% is above this threshold, indicating affordability concerns.

content.reasoning: The analysis identified critical policy violations, including a term length of 72 months which exceeds the maximum allowable term of 60 months, and a DTI ratio of 31.43% which is above the 35% threshold for the applicant's credit tier. These factors indicate a high risk level and non-compliance with underwriting policies.
